page.title: 01SOUTH OF DARTMOUTH (INTRO)
page.content: Dartmouth's coast has a range of beaches which unfortunately are not sandy.The main attraction is Britannia Royal Naval college but Dartmouth also has boating activities and a regatta. Moving further away from the town now up to a hill called Jawbones you can see a magnificent view of the river. There are three schools in the town, two primary and one secondary.We also have some farms around here.Some are dairy and some are no longer working. Little Cotton is a farm but is also a park and ride which takes you down to the town.Stoke Fleming is a small village which has two pubs,some shops and a school.It also has a church and a caravan site.
